questions.question: What frequency band does WiFi 6E introduce?
questions.explanation: WiFi 6E extends 802.11ax into the 6 GHz band for additional channels.

questions.question: What technology allows a single frequency channel to carry multiple data streams?
questions.explanation: MU-MIMO enables simultaneous transmission to multiple devices on the same channel.

questions.question: What technique divides channels into smaller resource units?
questions.explanation: OFDMA in WiFi 6 allows more efficient use of channels by dividing them into subcarriers.

questions.question: What modulation scheme does 802.11ax introduce for higher throughput?
questions.explanation: 1024-QAM enables higher data rates by encoding more bits per symbol.

questions.question: What 802.11 standard defines Quality of Service?
questions.explanation: 802.11e adds QoS capabilities for prioritizing different traffic types.

questions.question: What mechanism coordinates channel access in CSMA/CA?
alternatives: Request to Send Clear to Send
questions.explanation: RTS/CTS reduces collisions by reserving the medium before transmission.

questions.question: What technology enables multiple access points to work as a unified network?
questions.explanation: Mesh networks allow access points to interconnect and extend coverage seamlessly.

questions.question: What channel width does 802.11ac support for maximum throughput?
questions.explanation: 802.11ac can use 160 MHz wide channels for maximum data rates.

questions.question: What technique shapes radio signals to focus on specific devices?
questions.explanation: Beamforming improves signal strength and range by directing signals toward clients.

questions.question: What method prevents unauthorized access by filtering hardware addresses?
questions.explanation: MAC filtering allows only specific devices based on their hardware addresses.
